page.title: 01Rural Sussex East of Crawley
page.content: An area of flat terrain, bordered to the east by Copthorne village and to the west by the light industrial area of Crawley New Town and Gatwick airport-the second largest airport in Britain. The area's economy is dominated by these industrial and airport complexes, which provide the country's highest level of employment in a wide variety of jobs. The main London/costal railway and the M23 motorway bisect the area north/south. This has enhanced the area as a commuter belt, with people travelling to London/Croydon/Brighton and beyond for employment. The undeveloped areas contain small livestock farms and woodland. Copthorne village is expanding, with several housing developments. Bothschool and church have been focal points for over a century.
